sentences.english: Let not nemesis catch me by the swift ships.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓報應女神娜美西斯用快捷的船艦捉拿我。

sentences.english: Three wounded sailors were flown off the ship.
sentences.chinese: 三個受傷的水手被空運離開船艦。

sentences.english: Skill at the construction of advanced industrials.
sentences.chinese: 建造旗艦級船艦所需技能。

sentences.english: The navy's fleet of frigates, amphibious vessels, and other surface ships, will also be cut.
sentences.chinese: 海軍護衛艦，水陸兩棲艦，以及其他船艦也將被裁減。

sentences.english: No vehicles or vessels were permitted to pass the border.
sentences.chinese: 任何車輛和船艦都不准許通過邊境。

sentences.english: Skill at the construction of capital ships.
sentences.chinese: 建造旗艦級船艦所需技能。

sentences.english: The Pentagon reported that the first of these had been deployed.
sentences.chinese: 美國防部指出，這些首次亮相的海軍船艦已被部署。

definition: using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
Chinese treasure ship, a type of large sailing ship in the fleet of Ming dynasty admiral Zheng He 鄭和|郑和[Zheng4 He2]
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
the China Seas (the seas of the Western Pacific Ocean, around China: Bohai Sea, Yellow Sea, East China Sea, South China Sea)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
Huangyan Island (in the South China Sea)
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
see 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
